title: John Boehner’s Back
content:
At first blush , it might seem like a positive sign that two dozen Republicans voted against giving John Boehner another term as Speaker of the House . Congressional approval levels are at all-time lows , so it makes sense that at least that many members of Mr. Boehner ’ s own party thought better of giving him yet another opportunity to lead .
It might also seem comforting to hear Republicans talk about making Congress function again and seeking “ constructive ” dialogue and compromise . “ We all know that one of the things the Senate is best at is not doing much , and I hope we can work this out so we can get started , ” Mr. McConnell said , referring to a procedural dispute over when committees can start holding hearings .
But those who voted against Mr. Boehner wanted someone more , not less anathema to bi-partisanship , also known as governance . Never mind that he has been running the Republican caucus through all these years of implacable opposition to all of President Obama ’ s policies , and endless pointless hearings driven by a desire to bottle up the Democrats and the White House .
And Mr. McConnell ’ s call to “ get started ” is rich , to say the least . Practically as soon as Mr. Obama ’ s hand came off the Bible at his inauguration , Mr. McConnell vowed to make him a one-term president . He was the architect of the do-nothing Senate , a master at using Senate procedure to snarl things up .
What Mr. McConnell wants is to convene a hearing and then a Senate vote to clear the way for the Keystone XL pipeline . The fact that Mr. Obama has threatened to veto such a bill is no doubt a bonus for the new Senate Majority Leader .
After that vote , Mr. McConnell wants to move on to undermining Mr. Obama ’ s health care reform , and a whole list of other things that the Republicans pretend will help the middle class .
The Republicans won the midterm elections handily and now is their moment on Capitol Hill . But with Mr. Boehner and Mr. McConnell at the helm , I ’ m not optimistic .
